Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon Part 5: Mysterious Events At 2005 Tawsmead Copse "Insectogram" Crop Formation © 2005-2006 by Andrew J. Buckley Reprinted with permission at Earthfiles. Return to Part 1 March 13, 2007 Wiltshire County, England - Continued from Part 4. A Field Report © 2006 by Andrew J. Buckley. All rights reserved. " It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." - Antoine De Saint-Exupery L eft: Artist's impression of the mysterious girl seen by Gordon Stewart and Andy Buckley at Wilcot Brow and Tawsmead Copse, Alton Priors, Wiltshire, England, on Wednesday, August 10, 2005. Right: 2005 drawing of "insectogram" crop formation by Gill Nicholas. T he Vale of Pewsey, the village of Alton Priors is highlighted next to the red circle that marks the South Field. Also highlighted around the South Field

are Tawsmead Copse, Woodborough Hill and the big East Field on the other side of the brown country road. Andrew J. Buckley: " SUMMARY AND CONCLUSIONS 2) The 'Ball of Light' The 'ball of light' I observed on the morning of Friday, August 12, 2005, at Wilcot Brow was similar in appearance to other aerial phenomena observed and filmed not only by myself, but by many other researchers in the Vale of Pewsey area over the past fifteen years or so. On this occasion, I was able to fairly accurately determine that this 'object' 'was hovering over the position in the field (at Wilcot Brow) where I was to discover the 'insectogram' crop formation several minutes later. I had the very strong feeling that the ball of light was somehow guiding me to a specific place in the field, which was where the formation was presumably in the process of forming. Would it not, therefore, be unreasonable to conclude that the ball of light might actually have been responsible for the creation of this formation? Since the late 1980s, there has been some anecdotal evidence that some crop circles might have been formed by what could loosely be termed UFOs, balls of light, or luminosities. I would draw the reader's attention to the research undertaken by Dr. Eltjo Haselhoff, Ph.D., in his book The Deepening Complexity of Crop Circles. Dr. Haselhoff has produced peer reviewed scientific papers, which strongly suggest a provable connection between these balls of light (BOLS) and their creation of both simple and complex ground markings. I also felt that there was a very strong connection between this light phenomenon and the simultaneous appearance of the mysterious figure. 3) The Appearance of the Mysterious Girl By far the most intriguing and bizarre aspect of this whole event is the unexpected appearance of this mysterious figure. I accept that my conclusions regarding her role in these events will divide opinion from the believer to the die-hard skeptic. This is perfectly understandable, given the circumstances outlined in this report. However, as I mentioned earlier in this summary, I sense very strongly that the phenomenon is unmistakably moving into a new phase and acceptance will not come easy to some. The manifestation of unusual entities throughout history is, of course, well documented. The following quotations might therefore have relevance to the events described in this section of my report. 'It was about five years ago, when I was about sixteen, during the summer at about 9 PM when I was walking down the lane from my friend's house, I saw a tiny figure that looked like a moth in the hedgerow. I decided to investigate, as I am a keen entomologist; so, I quietly crept towards it. I didn't know at first, but it looked like a large moth or butterfly. Then when I was about a meter away from it, I saw the tiny body of a fairly young girl with wings like a butterfly. I was not imagining things; she was sitting in the hedge singing with the most beautiful voice. She fluttered out of sight into the field behind the hedge. Since I was sixteen, I have never told anyone because I thought they would never believe me.' - Charlotte Matthews, Tiny Female Faeries 'She stands at the edge of the trees, as melancholy as the twilight woods she haunts. She holds much knowledge and knows many secrets, for the restless winds bring her messages from distant forests ...' - Brian Froud, 'Wood Women' from Good Fairies/Bad Faeries 'Theosophists have described fairy beings as essentially glowing balls with a pinpoint of intense light at their centre. Rather than creatures with a permanent form, the elementals are the forces or energies that in nature and magic give shape to things and bring

thoughts and desires into actuality. They have the power to change their size and appearance almost at will.' - Cassandra Eason, A Complete Guide to Fairies & Magical Beings It should be emphasized that this mysterious figure of a young girl was seen no fewer than three times. The first observation in the presence of an additional witness, Gordon Stewart, on the evening of Wednesday, August 10, 2005 at 23:10 hours (11:10 PM). Gordon was adamant that he saw the figure of a very young female walking down the road to Wilcot and gave a very detailed description of her appearance. To all intents and purposes, the young girl was a physical, flesh and blood, human being. On the first occasion she was seen, we heard her speak and sing as she walked by us on the road. It was somewhat unusual to observe a very young, unaccompanied child walking the dark and lonely Wiltshire lanes at that late hour, and furthermore, to witness her crouching in the hedge near the Workway Drove track. Inquiries with the local villagers and Pewsey Police Station regarding the possibility of a missing child drew a blank. Also, there were no gypsies or travelers camping in the area at the time. Her presence at Tawsmead Copse on the morning of Friday, August 12, 2005, accompanied the appearance and discovery of the 'insectogram' crop formation and the sighting of the ball of light. Skeptics would, of course, argue that the timing of these events was purely coincidental. I would prefer the term 'synchronous' because, in some bizarre and as yet unexplained way, these events feel somehow interconnected. Three very important aspects of this phenomenon were inexplicably brought together that particular morning. But for what purpose? My own feelings, for what they are worth, suggest to me that the mysterious girl - whatever her identity - was not entirely of human origin. Superficially, she was three- dimensional, solid and cast shadows on the ground. However, the numinous quality and nature of her sudden appearance and disappearance belies that conclusion. Logic dictates that there was absolutely no way she could have done so without me being aware of her arrival on the scene as I was standing only a few yards from her position on the track. In the split second, I moved my focus of attention from observing the ball of light to raising my video camera to film her. There simply would not have been the time for her to have disappeared, either in the field or into the wooded copse without leaving some visual trace or sound. This fact alone precludes the possibility that we were dealing with a normal, every day situation. Returning to the conclusions of Patrick Harpur, mentioned earlier in this summary, where he states that the presence of non-human entities, 'though quite real, is as ambiguous as the phenomena themselves, just enough to convince those people who want to believe in their literal reality - just too little to win over the unbeliever.' In other words, unexplained entities such as the mysterious girl could be existing 'between realities,' tantalizingly elusive in some multi-dimensional state - real and yet unreal, wanting to be seen yet unwilling to offer tangible proof of her existence. In retrospect, if only I had obtained some video footage of her, or I had stopped my car on the Wednesday night to question her. Such is the nature of what I would term a 'chimerical manifestation.' Was she an elemental being? A fairy child? A ghost or spirit guide? My own gut feeling was that, despite her apparent 'solidness,' there were definitely aspects of her appearance and behaviour which point to an other worldly status. Apart from her chimerical characteristics already described, I did have a very overwhelming feeling that she wanted to communicate something profound to me - maybe concerning the crop circle phenomenon or the state of the environment - but not in a way that would be immediately understandable. In the few seconds I was in here presence, one crystal clear impression I received from her was that of innocence, which reminded me of this same atmosphere that typified our attitude towards the crop circle phenomenon in the early days of the late 1980s, and how those initial feelings of awe, wonder and curiosity have been corrupted in recent years by our obsession with quantification. There is a hankering for 'provable evidence,' or hoaxing and disinformation and all the negativity which has polluted and corrupted this

subject. If we are to advance further and move into a new paradigm, maybe it will only happen if we can somehow return to this state of childlike innocence. I will leave the final words to two brave 'voyagers' into the unknown. First, to one of Dr. John E. Mack's abductees named Karin, as described in Dr. Mack's book, Passport to the Cosmos . In April 1997, in a plea to a large audience in New York City, Karin spoke passionately of the possibilities she saw in the choice: that these phenomena are largely an opportunity or a gift, a kind of catalyst for the evolution of consciousness in the direction of an emerging sense of responsibility for our own and the planet's future. 'Perhaps it is that we have formed ourselves at a fork in the road and we are once again faced with making a choice. Couldn't we this time, finally, make the right one? Couldn't we simply reach out and embrace this experience and all that it brings with it, including the terror as well as the questions, truth and beauty? Because don't you think in doing so, we would at last learn about who and what we are? And isn't it possible that we just might learn what it is exactly that is the nature of the connection to the Creator as well as the Universe? Please, can't we this once choose the path that will finally set us free? Free to love, laugh and cry? Because after all, it is our ultimate destiny to live in the joy of being alive.' - Karin, Meeting of Friends of the Institute of Noetic Sciences, April 29, 1997 Secondly, to the answer that fictional astronaut and radio astronomer, Dr. Ellie Arroway, gave to her court questioners following her hypothetical space flight and alien contact at the end of the film Contact, inspired by the late astronomer and cosmologist, Carl Sagan, Ph.D. Questioner: 'Dr. Arroway, you come to us with no evidence, no record, no artifacts, only a story, that to put it mildly, strains credibility. ...Are you really going to sit there and tell us we should take this all on faith?' Dr. Arroway: 'Is it possible that it didn't happen? Yes. As a scientist, I must concede that.' Questioner: 'You admit that you have no physical evidence to back up your story? You admit that if you were in our position, you would react with the same degree of skepticism and incredulity?' Dr. Arroway: 'Yes.' Questioner: 'Then why don't you concede that this journey to the center of the galaxy never took place?' Dr. Arroway: 'Because I can't. I had an experience that I cannot prove, or explain, but everything I know as a human being tells me it was real. I was given something wonderful, something that changed me forever ... a vision that tells us that we belong to something that is greater than ourselves, and that how significant and precious we all are. And that none of us are alone. I wish that everyone could feel that awe, humility and hope.'" Andrew John Buckley © 2005.
